text: think of willpower like a muscle while
many of us build muscle by regularly
hitting the gym you can train your
willpower to become stronger and more
resilient too neglect to train it and
your willpower self-discipline and focus
will easily crumble in the face of
Temptation and distractions you'll be
surprised at how much easier it becomes
to achieve everything you set out to do
once you quit your bad habits and
eliminate distractions But first you
need to develop a strong will and that's
where science comes in in today's video
we'll disc some science-backed
strategies to help you build Ironclad
unbeatable willpower and be stronger
than ever let's get to it number one
know your why to build unbreakable
willpower you must start with Clarity on
why you want it in the first place
according to psychologist Roy bow
Meister purpose-driven goals boost
willpower by linking our efforts to a
deeper reason acting as a powerful
psychological anchor this is a principle
that other psychologists have adopted
too Angela Duckworth psychologist and
author from the University of
Pennsylvania emphasizes that resilience
and success often come from perseverance
toward long-term goals which requires a
clear purpose take a minute to write
down your goals and revisit them
regularly this will strengthen your Why
by connecting your efforts to a bigger
purpose you're more likely to stick with
it and resist distractions number two
break it down rather than tackling
Everything at Once break your objectives
down into smaller achievable steps Dr
Andrew huberman explains that small
consistent wins release dopamine the
brain's reward chemical this reinforces
positive behaviors and creates what he
calls a forward Center of mass
essentially it makes it easier to stay
on track because small victories create
momentum and momentum propels you
forward for example instead of saying I
want to get fit start with something
small like I'll do 10 push-ups every
morning when you achieve these small
goals you're more likely to keep going
because your brain Rewards you with a
dopamine boost it's like getting a small
victory that encourages you to move on
to the next step number three
understanding dopamine dopamine is a
powerful and important neurotransmitter
in our brain chemistry it's responsible
for providing motivation Cravings
desires and our reward-seeking
Tendencies our daily lives are packed
with highly stimulating dopamine driving
activities social media video games and
watching private online videos can all
flood our brains with dopamine this
constant dopamine SE
can desensitize the brain making it
harder to focus on less stimulating
tasks such as putting in the work to
achieve your goals consider trying a
dopamine detox to reset your brain's
tendency to seek High arousal dopamine
releasing activities focus on low
stimulus activities like journaling
reading or going for a walk it'll be
difficult at first but the longer you
stick with it the easier it'll become to
enjoy low arousal activities this will
help rewire the brain to find
satisfaction in tasks that aren't IM
immediately rewarding which is essential
for building willpower and discipline
number four reframe temptation as an
opportunity Temptations can be obstacles
but they can also be opportunities to
exercise mental toughness in the mind
and the Brain author Jeffrey Schwarz
describes how our brains are remarkably
capable of change a concept called
neuroplasticity when we actively resist
temptation we strengthen the circuits in
the brain associated with self-control
instead of seeing temp ations as a
potential failure reframe them as
opportunities to practice
self-discipline for instance when you
feel the urge to procrastinate just tell
yourself this is my chance to build
resilience by actively choosing a
different action you're rewiring your
brain to strengthen your willpower
Pathways in a way Temptation becomes a
tool for building your self-control
muscle number five redirect your focus
with implementation intentions now stay
with us it's not as complicated as it
sounds one effective way to build
self-discipline is through if then
planning or implementation intentions a
strategy developed by psychologist Peter
go witzer these are simple if then
statements such as if I feel the urge to
procrastinate then I'll set a timer and
work for 5 more minutes having a clear
plan you cons serve your willpower and
can bypass distractions more effectively
for example you could try if I want to
pick up my phone to scroll on social
media then I'll read for 10 minutes
instead if I have the urge to watch
online videos then I'll go outside for a
brisk walk run or go to the gym this
approach helps your brain get used to
new habits making self-discipline easier
and more automatic number six practice
delayed gratification to build
resilience the ability to delay
gratification is a core component of
willpower social psychologist Walter
Michelle conducted the classic
marshmallow test where he showed that
children who could wait for a second
marshmallow were more successful later
in life motivational speaker and author
Brian Tracy in his book no excuses the
power of self-discipline explains that
practicing delayed gratification is
essential for self-discipline you can
start small when you crave something
immediately like a snack or social media
tell yourself to wait 5 to 10 minutes
this strengthens your impulse control
and rewires your brain for long-term
thinking a critical part of sustained
willpower choose a fun and engaging
distraction and most of the time you'll
forget about your craving alt together
number seven Embrace discomfort and grow
your willpower growth happens when you
step outside of your comfort zone
remember Angela Duckworth the
psychologist we spoke about earlier
Duckworth's research shows that
resilience and success often come from a
willingness to push through challenges
and discomfort try incorporating small
discomforts into your routine like
taking cold showers waking up earlier or
challenging yourself to try something
new these exercises in discomfort will
not only build resilience but also train
your brain to handle challenges without
giving up over time you'll notice that
you can push through bigger obstacles
with more ease number eight bouncing
back from a setback now willpower isn't
about perfection it's about resilience
there will be times that are harder than
others but it's your ability to bounce
back that matters most not the obstacles
you face along the way often criticizing
yourself drains willpower creating a
negative cycle when you experience a
setback look at it as a learning
opportunity instead of getting
discouraged ask yourself what went wrong
and why if you're really honest with
yourself you can often pinpoint the
problem and find the solution take a
moment to understand the triggers or
situations that led to the setback and
develop a plan to avoid or navigate them
in the future number nine take care of
your physical health although it's
important to focus on the psychology of
willpower and self-discipline the way
you look after your body matters too
getting quality sleep a balanced diet
and regular exercise all boosts brain
function which in turn makes you more
resilient to Temptations and better at
sticking to your goals prioritize these
Basics aim for 7 to 8 hours of quality
sleep nourish your body with balanced
meals and get moving daily these habits
ensure that your mind and body are fit
and ready to support your goals physical
health doesn't just keep you going dayto
day it gives you the resilience to make
long-term changes in conclusion
willpower isn't an inborn trait it's a
skill you can train just like any other
building discipline is a journey but
it's incredibly rewarding let's recap
the strategies you can Implement to help
strengthen your willpower know your why
plan out why you want to change your
life break down tasks into manageable
chunks understand dopamine and why it
works reframe temptation as an
opportunity use implementation
intentions like if then statement to
combat Cravings practice delayed
gratification Embrace discomfort bounce
back after setbacks look after your body
and mind pick one or two strategies to
start and as they become habits add more
you'll soon notice a stronger more
disciplined version of yourself emerging
drop a comment and let us know which
willpower strategy you're going to try
first thanks for watching and if you
found this helpful don't forget to like
subscribe and share with someone to
really level up their willpower
